A Zacks Rank #5 (Strong Sell) further confirms weakness in VIRT.

A key reason for this move has been the negative trend in earnings estimate revisions. For the full year, we have seen two estimates moving down in the past 30 days, compared with no upward revisions. This trend has caused the consensus estimate to trend lower, going from $1.52 a share a month ago to its current level of $1.20.

The stock also has seen some pretty dismal trading lately, as the share price has dropped 14.8% in the past month.
